\section{Generation of MIT 18.06: Introduction to Linear Algebra}
\label{sec:generation-18.06}

\begin{longtable}{|l|p{8cm}|p{8cm}|} 
\caption{New questions generated from 18.06 Linear Algebra questions, and the closest question among the existing questions.}\\
\hline
\textbf{ID} & \textbf{Auto-Generated question} & \textbf{Closest question in the dataset}\\
\hline
1 & Find a basis for the nullspace of $A$. Here $A[1,1,0;0,0,5;1,1,1]$. & Construct a 2 by 2 matrix whose nullspace equals its column space. This is possible.

\\
\hline
2 & Visualize the subspace that spans $\{x+y   2, x   2, x   0\}$, draw axes (black), draw a vector, show that vector's coordinates. & Find $A'A$ if the columns of $A$ are unit vectors, all mutually perpendicular.

\\
\hline
3 & Find the projection of $b(4,4,-4)$ onto $[4,-4,1]$ & What linear combination of $(1,2,-1)$ and $(1,0,1)$ is closest to $b(2,1,1)$?

\\
\hline
4 & Consider a symmetric matrix $M$, with $N$ rows and columns. We ask that $x^T*M*x \geq 0$ for all vectors $x$. Show that $M$ must be singular. & Find singular matrices $A$ and $B$ such that $A+B$ is invertible.

\\ 
\hline
5 & Interpret the inverse of: $[0,3;-2,-1]$ and $[-1,2;30,8]$ & Find the inverses (directly or from the 2 by 2 formula) of $A, B, C : A   [0,4;3,0], B   [2,0;4,2], \text{ and } C   [3,4;5,7]$.

\\
\hline
6 & Use singular value decomposition to find the vectors perpendicular to vectors $(1 2 3), (1 2), (3 8, 1)$. & Find $A'A$ if the columns of $A$ are unit vectors, all mutually perpendicular.

\\
\hline
7 & Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the matrix $A[4,0;1,1;1,2]$. & Find the eigenvalues of A and B (easy for triangular matrices) and $A + B: A   [3,0;1,1], B   [1,1;0,3], A+B   [4,1;1,4]$.

\\
\hline
8 & Consider the matrix $A[1,2;2,3;3,3;3,1;1,1]$. Provide details on how the matrix is changed when it goes through the following two terms. a) $[x1;x1;x1^2;x1(x1+2*x2);x2(x1+2*x2)-x1;x1]$ b) $[x1+x1^2;2*(x2+x2^2);3*(x3 + x3^1);3*x3^2;x3^3]$ & Suppose a linear $T$ transforms $(1,1)$ to $(2,2)$ and $(2,0)$ to $(0,0)$. Find $T(v)$, when $v[2,2]$, $v(3,1)$, $v(-1,1)$, $v(a,b)$. 

\\
\hline
9 & Write a Matlab code to determine if the given matrix $A[1,1;4,4]$ is positive semidefinite and if it is negative semidefinite. & For which numbers $b$ is the following matrices positive definite? $S[1,b;b,9], S[2,4;4,c], S[c,b;b,c]$.

\\
\hline
10 & Find the dot product b   $(5;5;5) \cdot (1;1;1)$ & Find the linear combination $3s_1\; +\; 4s_2\; +\; 5s_3\; \; b$. Then write $b$ as a matrix-vector multiplication $S_x$, with $3, 4, 5$ in $x$. Compute the three dot products (row of $S$)· $x:s_1$   $[1;1;1]$, $s_2$   $[0;1;1]$, $s_3$   $[0;0;1]$
\\ \hline
\end{longtable}
title: A Neural Network Solves, Explains, and Generates University Math Problems by Program Synthesis and Few-Shot Learning at Human Level
